properties.short description: Roger II Travels to Salerno
properties.description: Roger II sails to Salerno after the death of his cousin, Duke William of Apulia.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
William, Duke of Apulia
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Pope Honorius II Travels to Benevento
properties.description: Pope Honorius II travels to Benevento to warn Roger II against continuing his conquest.
properties.people:
Honorius II, Pope
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Return to Sicily
properties.description: Roger II returns to Sicily for the winter months, during which time he prepares for invasion in 1129.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Moves to Lagopesole and Confronts Robert de Grandmesnil
properties.description: Roger II brought his army to Lagopesole, where Robert de Grandmesnil was located, and charged him with desertion.  Robert de Grandmesnil traded his lands in exchange for safe passage across the Alps.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Robert de Grandmesnil, Lord
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Returns to Sicily
properties.description: At the end of the 1129 campaigning season, Roger II returned to Sicily for the winter months.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Arrives at Melfi after the Third Siege of Troia
properties.description: Roger II arrives at Melfi and rebuilds their fortifications.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Returns to Salerno
properties.description: In preparation for his regency, Roger II moves to Salerno in order to discuss details with various people he trusted.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Arrives at the Ravello Siege
properties.description: King Roger II arrives from across the sea during the siege of Ravello
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Returns to Salerno
properties.description: After his victory, Roger II returns to Salerno
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Countess Matilda Arrives in Salerno
properties.description: Countess Matilda arrived in Salerno in 1131.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Brings Matilda and Her Child Back to Sicily
properties.description: Because of Rainulf II's refusal to return dower lands to Count Matilda, Roger II brought both her and her son with him back to Sicily.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Matilda, Countess
Robert, Son to Matilda and Rainulf II
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II arrives at Taranto for Conquest
properties.description: Returning in 1132, Roger II crosses the Straits of Messina and begins to attack Taranto.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Robert II and Rainulf II Moved to Tressanti
properties.description: The prince and count travel to Tressanti some time after settling cavalry in the Caudine valley.
properties.people:
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Traveled from Salerno to Bari
properties.description: To stop rebellion in Bari, Roger II travelled to the city.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Traveled Back to Salerno
properties.description: Roger II returned to Salerno once Bari was settled and his towns around Benevento were garrisoned.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Returned to Sicily to Await the Next Campaigning Season
properties.description: Once he had made his orders, Roger II returned to Sicily in December of 1132
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Rainulf II Met With Count Godfrey and Alexander in Apulia
properties.description: To solidify their alliance, Rainulf II met with Count Godfrey and his ilk under the recommendation of Robert II.
properties.people:
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
Godfrey, Count of Andria
Alexander, Count
Tancred of Conversano
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Lothar, King of the Germans, Arrived in Rome
properties.description: The contemporary king of the Germans, Lothar, arrived in Rome on 30 April 1133.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Count Alexander Fled to Rainulf II
properties.description: Fearing the wrath of Roger II, Alexander fled to Rainulf II while he was still in Rome.
properties.people:
Lothar, King of the Germans
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
Alexander, Count
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Alexander Became Destitute in Avlone after Fleeing
properties.description: Count Alexander did not find fortune in hiding, and lived "in a very poor and hungry fashion."
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Count Rainulf Prepares Army in the Caudine Valley
properties.description: Expecting Roger II to advance, Count Rainulf II gathered forces in the Caudine Valley to prepare for a pitched battle.
properties.people:
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
Sergius VII, Duke of Naples
Hugh, Count of Boiano
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Rainulf Returned to the Caudine Valley
properties.description: Once he had visited Naples and Aversa, Rainulf returned to his troops in the valley.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Celebrates at Salerno
properties.description: Having conquered almost all of Apulia, Roger II stops in Salerno to celebrate.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Arrived from Sicily in Salerno
properties.description: Roger II returned to mainland Italy for another season of campaigning.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Returned to Salerno
properties.description: Roger II returned to Salerno after a successful campaigning season.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Returned to Sicily
properties.description: Upon the end of his campaigning season, Roger II came back to Sicily for the winter months.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Prince Robert II Arrives in Naples on This Date
properties.description: Returning with Pisan troops, Robert II arrives in Naples to join forces with Sergius VII.
properties.people:
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
Sergius VII, Duke of Naples
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Count Rainulf Returned to Caiazzo
properties.description: After failing to win back Capua, Count Rainulf returned to Caiazzo.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Rainulf II Traveled to Naples with Forces
properties.description: At the behest of the Prince of Capua, Rainulf traveled to Naples with the forces he had collected.
properties.people:
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: John and Guarin Take Refuge in Capua
properties.description: To prevent themselves from being captured, John and Guarin returned to Capua.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Arrived in Salerno on This Date
properties.description: Roger II is recorded to have arrived in Salerno on 5 June 1135.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Rainulf II Fled From Roger II
properties.description: Fearing the quick fall of Aversa, Rainulf fled from the city with many of its inhabitants.  He traveled to Naples to reconvene with Robert II.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Arrival of Pisan Reinforcements
properties.description: In response to a call to arms, Pisa sent more ships to Naples for Robert II's use against Roger II.
properties.people: Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Pisans Return to Pisa
properties.description: The Pisans traveled back to Pisa along with Prince Robert II, who intended to return early next campaigning season.
properties.people: Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Dispatchment of Matilda to Sicily
properties.description: To protect his sister, and to rob Count Rainulf II of his wife, Roger II sent Matilda to Sicily.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Returned to Sicily by 10 October 1135
properties.description: King Roger II returned to Sicily by boat and landed in Palermo.  He planned to invade again next spring.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Adam Avenel Took Charge of Aversa
properties.description: Adam Avenel used Aversa's knights to begin pillaging Naples.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
